unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop competency in working individually or as a team in the laboratory and tutorials
Articulate and practice appropriate health, safety and ethical standards relevant to medical science
Describe global health issues of significance to society today using appropriate scientific terminology
Develop and demonstrate competencies in standard laboratory techniques (e.g. dilutions, aseptic technique, imagery and measurement, labelling, diagnostic sample preparation)
Describe and practice scientific methods from generating hypotheses and predictions to designing experimental procedures, and undertaking data collection

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: 1h work after each tute (8), 1h after each lecture (10) and 1h after each prac (9)

assessments.description: Attendance at, and participation in, weekly practicals and tutorials is compulsory. Participation will be demonstrated by actively undertaking the experiments, and will be recorded. Students may be able to attend a make-up class, or else a Special Consideration request must be submitted.
The mid-term exam has a quiz-based section where students will be tested on their knowledge.
The mid-term exam has a practice-based section where students will be tested on their lab skills.
The final exam has a practice-based section where students will be tested on their lab skills.
Students will be provided with pre-prac information and need to complete a quiz / short written piece before each class (45min x 8 assessment activities).
The final exam has a quiz-based section where students will be tested on their knowledge.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
data.description: This unit provides foundation skills required for working in medical and life sciences laboratories. Skills will be learnt in the context of current global health issues including antimicrobial resistance and malaria, health reporters such as immunity and haematology and approaches to disease diagnosis. Students will acquire hands-on laboratory skills, including aseptic technique for microbiology, use of microscopes and spectrophotometers, extraction of bioactive molecules, and data collection and analyses. Students will hear from medical and life science researchers who will provide context for the weekly skills topics and information on the diverse employment areas in medical science. Students also begin to acquire skills in interpreting and citing scientific literature and developing a foundation in communication skills and scientific writing.
data.title: Foundation in Life Sciences

description: This unit provides foundation skills required for working in medical and life sciences laboratories. Students will acquire hands-on laboratory skills, including aseptic technique for microbiology, use of microscopes and spectrophotometers, extraction of bioactive molecules, and data collection and analyses. Students will hear from medical and life science researchers who will provide context for the weekly skills topics and information on the diverse employment areas in medical science. Students also begin to acquire skills in interpreting and citing scientific literature and developing a foundation in communication skills and scientific writing.
title: Foundation in Life Sciences
